Question: I have intrusive thoughts or obsessions that are distressing or unwanted.
I engage in repetitive behaviors or rituals to reduce anxiety caused by obsessions.
I spend a significant amount of time each day performing rituals or mental acts.
I experience distress when I'm unable to perform my rituals or compulsions.
I have difficulty controlling or stopping my intrusive thoughts or compulsive behaviors.
I feel ashamed or embarrassed by my obsessions or compulsions.
I avoid situations or triggers that may worsen my obsessions or compulsions.
I recognize that my obsessions or compulsions are excessive or irrational.
I experience anxiety or distress when my environment is not organized or symmetrical.
I frequently check or recheck things to ensure they are done correctly.
I have specific rules or orderings that I must follow to prevent harm or disaster.
I struggle to focus on tasks or activities due to intrusive thoughts.
I experience relief or decreased anxiety after performing my rituals or compulsions.
I feel compelled to confess or seek reassurance about my obsessions or compulsions.
I experience unwanted mental images or urges that are distressing.
